CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 10 - Freedom of expression -{General}
JUDGES: Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .
CARDINAL . The applicant works as a teacher in PERSON . In DATE he was also a member of ORG ( PERSON w PERSON ) .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant wanted to publish an article in the local newspaper ( Gazeta Kazimierska ) on alleged financial irregularities in the municipality . As the newspaper had been closed down , the applicant published the article himself . On DATE he distributed it in the form of leaflets .

CARDINAL . NORP In his article entitled “ Information Bulletin : What the president of the City Council and the City Council Board have to hide ” , he referred to CARDINAL municipality officials . He stated that PERSON had been so busy interfering with the employment policies of the local schools that they had not had time to administer the municipal educational funds properly . As a consequence teachers and employers of the municipal educational institutions had not received allowances ( for protective clothing ) which under relevant legal provisions they should have received . In addition , the physical education teachers had received lower salaries without a certain PERCENT allowance . In the applicant ’s opinion the teachers did not claim this allowance as they had been afraid to lose their jobs . When the applicant had informed the mayors - T. B. , PERSON and the president of ORG PERSON the financial irregularities , he had been dismissed from his post . He had eventually been reinstated .

CARDINAL . The applicant further claimed that the municipality had received subsidies from the ORG to provide transport for children to schools . However , the schools had been required to pay an additional contribution to the municipality . The applicant maintained that PERSON had known about this situation but had failed to take appropriate action . In addition she had not acted for the benefit of the school employees . Parties which had been organised for city council members had been wholly financed from public funds .

CARDINAL . Lastly , the applicant stated that he was not surprised that PERSON had not replied to an inquiry from ORG ( PERSON ) as the municipal budget surplus had probably been used to pay bonuses and per diem allowances for the council members .
He concluded :
“ I encourage the readers to reconsider whether DATE the city was governed by the right people ; whether these people can be offered yet another term of office in the DATE elections .
Whether during DATE they have indeed acted honestly for the common well - being of the ORG community or in their own personal interests .
Can these people be trusted again with the city council mandates ? ”
CARDINAL . On TIME the NORP group in ORG ( representing PERSON and PERSON ) instituted proceedings against the applicant under LAW of LAW . The applicant had not been aware of that fact .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s mother was informed that the applicant was supposed to appear before the court DATE at TIME She could not inform the applicant as he was in GPE on DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) held a hearing and gave a decision . It ordered the applicant to publish in the local newspaper ORG an apology and a statement that he had included untrue information in his leaflet . It further ordered the applicant to pay a fine of MONEY ( PLN ) ( approx . MONEY ( ORG ) ) for the benefit of ORG in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant went personally to ORG and was informed about the decision taken on DATE . On DATE he lodged an appeal .
CARDINAL . The local elections took place on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Sąd Apelacyjny ) quashed the first - instance decision and remitted the case . The court considered that the applicant had not been duly summoned to the hearing held on DATE . The applicant had not been able to defend himself in person and accordingly the proceedings had been invalid .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave a decision . The court ordered the applicant to publish in the local newspaper ORG an apology for the fact that he had included untrue information in his leaflet . It further ordered the applicant to pay a fine of ORG MONEY ( approx . EUR CARDINAL ) for the benefit of ORG in GPE . The court held that the applicant ’s article concerned CARDINAL municipal officials but amongst them CARDINAL were members of the NORP group . None of them had been elected to ORG in the local elections . The court heard evidence from these persons and considered that the applicant ’s statements had been untrue . The article distributed by the applicant contained statements which lacked any factual basis . In addition , it could have caused the fact that ORG and PERSON had not been elected to the city council and PERSON had received fewer votes . The court further stressed that the applicant had not mentioned that he had a criminal record . On CARDINAL DATE he had been convicted of participation in a hooligan scuffle and sentenced to DATE imprisonment , suspended for DATE . Lastly , in the court ’s opinion , the applicant had deliberately distributed the leaflet during the election campaign . The court did not quote the statements made by the applicant in his article but made a general assessment of the content of the article .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed an appeal by the applicant as lodged outside the prescribed time - limit . The court considered that as the proceedings had been conducted under LAW the appeal should have been lodged within TIME .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant asked to be allowed to lodge an appeal out of time . In his appeal the applicant claimed that since DATE he had informed various institutions about financial irregularities on the part of the municipal authorities . He added that he had planned to publish his article in a local newspaper , ORG ; however the newspaper had been closed down . Relying on LAW he maintained that he had been punished for criticising the local authority . However , as it emerged from ORG Rights’ case - law the limitations of acceptable criticism were wider as regards politicians than as regards private individuals . He further stressed that the court had based its opinion , that the applicant ’s statements were untrue , only on the testimonies of the persons concerned by the article . The court had not referred to other pieces of evidence such as documents submitted by the applicant . He further claimed that ORG had not heard evidence from him . Finally , he stressed that in his article he had never mentioned the NORP group but had only referred to the municipal officials .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the applicant to appeal out of time .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave its decision . The court amended the first - instance decision , in that it ordered the applicant to pay ORG CARDINAL PLN ( approx . CARDINAL ) for the benefit of ORG in GPE and dismissed the remainder of his appeal . The court did not quote passages from the leaflet but made a general assessment of the content of the article . With reference to the applicant ’s allegations that the process of obtaining evidence had been unfair , the court held that the applicant could have produced evidence of this during the hearing on CARDINAL DATE ; however he had not done so . It further considered that the applicant ’s untrue statements could not be considered as part of “ acceptable criticism ” within the meaning of LAW . It considered that proceedings provided for under section CARDINAL of LAW were aimed at ensuring the proper conduct of the electoral campaign by preventing infringements of the personal rights of those standing for election . ORG considered that the content of the leaflet put the claimants in an unambiguously negative light as candidates for the local council and was aimed at preventing them from being elected . The court in particular referred to the concluding remarks of the article . ORG considered that they were incompatible with section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW . In these circumstances ORG found that the decision of ORG was correct .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the Law of DATE on Elections to GPE , ORG ( ORG wyborcza do rad gmin , rad powiatów i sejmików województw ) ( “ the LAW ” ) provided , in so far as relevant :

“ § CARDINAL . If posters , slogans , leaflets , statements or other forms of propaganda and campaigning contain untrue data and information , a candidate standing for local election or a representative of an electoral committee has the right to make an application asking ORG to :

CARDINAL ) NORP issue an injunction restraining [ the defendant ] from publishing such data and information ,
CARDINAL ) NORP order the information to be corrected ,
CARDINAL ) NORP order [ the defendant ] to apologise to the aggrieved party ,
CARDINAL ) NORP order [ the defendant ] to pay to a charity up to PLN CARDINAL,CARDINAL ,

§ CARDINAL . ORG , sitting as a single judge , shall examine the application referred to in DATE within TIME in [ civil ] non - contentious proceedings . [ ... ] . The court shall serve on the interested party referred to in § CARDINAL , the relevant regional electoral commissioner and the person obligated to execute the court ’s decision , without undue delay , a decision terminating the proceedings in the case .

§ CARDINAL . Decisions of ORG may be appealed to ORG within TIME of the time they are pronounced . ORG , sitting as a panel of CARDINAL judges , shall examine the appeal in [ civil ] non - contentious proceedings , according to the same procedure and within the time - limit referred to in § CARDINAL . No appeal shall lie against decisions of ORG and any decision shall be enforceable with immediate effect . ”

On DATE ORG amended section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW by repealing subsection CARDINAL , which allowed a claimant to seek compensation from a person who has divulged untrue information about him / her .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave a decision in case no . I ACz CARDINAL/CARDINAL in which it stated :

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the LAW applies to factual statements contained in materials pertaining to an electoral campaign . It does not apply to conclusions or opinions based on those factual statements . Only factual statements have an objective character . Every opinion is subjective and depends on the point of view of the person holding it .

CARDINAL . No one can be prevented from expressing his views and making judgments as long as they do not infringe the rights of others . However , even an infringement of personal rights which does not meet the conditions specified in section DATE can not be afforded protection under that provision which is an exception [ to the general rule ] and thus can not be interpreted extensively .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave a decision in the case no . IACz CARDINAL/CARDINAL in which it held :

“ Section CARDINAL of LAW [ ... ] is an exceptional provision and as such can not be construed extensively . That provision is applicable solely to untrue information included in electoral materials . It is not applicable to comments and opinions concerning the character of a candidate [ standing for election ] . If such comments and opinions infringe the candidate ’s personal rights , he may seek redress under the general rules [ of protection of personal rights ] , and not on the basis of LAW of LAW . ”
